result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan Douglas Lacy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Defendant shall participate in an AODA assessment, a batterers' intervention program and all other counseling or treatment programs as directed by his supervising agent. 
Defendant shall provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis. Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice.
Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.
Defendant shall obtain and maintain full time employment or school or a combination thereof.
Defendant shall take medications only as prescribed.
Defendant shall not have direct or indirect contact with victim JLS or her residence or place of employment.

Defendant Ryan Douglas Lacy in court, in custody. Attorney Michelle A. Wenninger in court for Ryan Douglas Lacy. Attorney Elizabeth A Longo in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Longo advises that victim called DAs office and asked to appear by phone. Zoom information just provided to victim by victim witness personnel. Case passed and recalled. Victim now appears by phone. Verbal impact statement presented by victim. Sentencing arguments presented by counsel. Statements by defendant. Defendant sentenced.

Defendant Ryan Douglas Lacy in court, in custody. Attorney Michelle A. Wenninger in court for Ryan Douglas Lacy. Attorney Elizabeth A Longo in court for State of Wisconsin. State requests adj of sentencing in that victim requested to be present but victim unable to be here today due to car problems on the way to court. Atty. Wenninger opposes adjournment. Sentencing adjourned. State to confirm adjournment with victim. Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Sentencing hearing on September 23, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Ryan Douglas Lacy in court, in custody. Attorney Michelle A. Wenninger in court for Ryan Douglas Lacy. Attorney Elizabeth A Longo in court for State of Wisconsin.  Partial joint recommendation, free to argue condition time. State requests adjourning sentencing to allow victim to be present; On a plea to Ct 1-3 in this case, State moves to dismiss and read in case 22CM145, No contest plea entered on Ct 1, Ct 2 and Ct 3; Court finds defendant guilty on Ct's 1-3, on motion of the State case 22CM145 is dismissed for read in. Sentencing adjourned. Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Sentencing hearing on September 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Per counsel, HE set in Br 2 on 9-7-22 at 11:30 for global resolution.
Defendant's Motion and Demand for Discovery & Inspection
No contact with JLS or JLS residence

Defendant Ryan Douglas Lacy in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Stephanie L Hanson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found. Court informs Defendant of DNA expungement rights. Defendant eligible for State Public Defender. Not guilty plea entered by Court. Court sets $2000 cash bond. Hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
